message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the problem of sampling data defined on the nodes of a weighted graph, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several CS sub-fields. However, the use of spectral graph theory to define a cut-off frequency for bandlimited graph signals suggests that the paper is likely to be classified under cs.IT (Information Theory) or cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the focus on finding the subset of nodes with the largest cut-off frequency or a given cut-off frequency suggests that the paper may also be relevant to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the study of the performance of random uniform sampling suggests that the paper may also be relevant to cs.NA (Numerical Analysis).
